intro: Peucedanum tenuifolium var. hypoleucum, commonly known as the white cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional herbal medicine for their digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's structure and growth habits make it a distinctive member of the carrot family.
